TypeSignature.Value: .class nested public auto ansi abstract sealed beforefieldinit VisualStyleElement/ExplorerBar/SpecialGroupExpand extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Provides objects for each state of the expand button of a special group of items in the Explorer Bar. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Each property of the VisualStyleElement.ExplorerBar.SpecialGroupExpand class gets a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement> for a different state of the expand button of a special group of items in the Explorer Bar, such as the **Music Tasks** group in Windows Explorer.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to create a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer> with the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement> returned by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement.ExplorerBar.SpecialGroupExpand.Normal%2A> property. To run this example, paste it into a Windows Form. Handle the form’s <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Paint> event and call the `DrawVisualStyleElementExplorerBarSpecialGroupExpand1` method from the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Paint> event-handling method, passing `e` as <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PaintEventArgs>.
[!code-cs[System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyleElementsExamples#162](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/ff45cfb4-62b7-486b-997b-_1.cs)] [!code-vb[System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyleElementsExamples#162](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/ff45cfb4-62b7-486b-997b-_1.vb)]

Docs.summary: Gets a visual style element that represents a hot expand button of a special group of items in the Explorer Bar.
Docs.value: A that represents a hot expand button.

remarks.format:
## Remarks You can use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement> returned by the Hot property to create a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer>.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to create a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer> with the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement> returned by the Hot property. To run this example, paste it into a Windows Form. Handle the form’s <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Paint> event and call the `DrawVisualStyleElementExplorerBarSpecialGroupExpand2` method from the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Paint> event-handling method, passing `e` as <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PaintEventArgs>.
[!code-cs[System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyleElementsExamples#163](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/1ad70140-5500-4da7-b204-_1.cs)] [!code-vb[System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyleElementsExamples#163](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/1ad70140-5500-4da7-b204-_1.vb)]

Docs.summary: Gets a visual style element that represents a normal expand button of a special group of items in the Explorer Bar.
Docs.value: A that represents a normal expand button.

remarks.format:
## Remarks You can use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement> returned by the Normal property to create a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer>.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to create a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer> with the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement> returned by the Normal property. To run this example, paste it into a Windows Form. Handle the form’s <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Paint> event and call the `DrawVisualStyleElementExplorerBarSpecialGroupExpand1` method from the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Paint> event-handling method, passing `e` as <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PaintEventArgs>.
[!code-cs[System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyleElementsExamples#162](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/e79f06b1-32d2-49ee-a8a6-_1.cs)] [!code-vb[System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyleElementsExamples#162](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/e79f06b1-32d2-49ee-a8a6-_1.vb)]

Docs.summary: Gets a visual style element that represents a pressed expand button of a special group of items in the Explorer Bar.
Docs.value: A that represents a pressed expand button.

remarks.format:
## Remarks You can use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement> returned by the Pressed property to create a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer>.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to create a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer> with the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement> returned by the Pressed property. To run this example, paste it into a Windows Form. Handle the form’s <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Paint> event and call the `DrawVisualStyleElementExplorerBarSpecialGroupExpand3` method from the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Paint> event-handling method, passing `e` as <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PaintEventArgs>.
[!code-cs[System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyleElementsExamples#164](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/55ce81db-92e5-4b79-8e13-_1.cs)] [!code-vb[System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyleElementsExamples#164](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/55ce81db-92e5-4b79-8e13-_1.vb)]
